verb.description: Suppose to be the case, without proof.
examples: it is reasonable to assume that such changes have significant social effects
they were assumed to be foreign
you're afraid of what people are going to assume about me

verb.description: Take or begin to have (power or responsibility)
examples: he assumed full responsibility for all organizational work

verb.description: Take on (a specified quality, appearance, or extent)
examples: militant activity had assumed epidemic proportions

origin: Late Middle English: from Latin assumere, from ad- towards + sumere take.
